segments.text: I notice the water is just pouring out of the sink like a waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right in it, and she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for her because she’s going to have a huge mess to clean up later.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really pushing his luck with that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, completely trusting him not to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be so upset when she finally notices the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just so chaotic, but no one seems to realize it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how much water is already on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are going to get in so much trouble if they get caught.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this is one of those moments that’s going to end in tears.
segments.speaker: PAR
